general.headline: Partner at Allens
general.description:
Simun is an experienced financial services regulatory lawyer. His clients include banks, superannuation trustees and fund managers, insurers, financial product distributors and industry bodies. 

He is experienced in:
Financial products – Advising on the development of new products and product changes, disclosure obligations, and the reviewing and implementation of distribution and remuneration arrangements (including FOFA).

Major transactions – Advising on the sale and purchase of insurers, administrators and other wealth management businesses, mergers of superannuation funds and transfers of insurance business, and directors' and fiduciary duties in the context of transactions, and superannuation and insurance aspects of corporate transactions.

Payments – Advising on the regulation of payments and new payment products, including implementation of the New Payments Platform.

Investigations – Responding to regulatory investigations, conducting incident and compliance reviews, and working with clients to design appropriate remediation programs.

Fintech and regtech - Advising on the development of 'robo advice' tools, the regulatory implications of new technologies and building automated regulatory compliance tools.

Simun regularly publishes and presents on financial services regulatory developments. He has presented at the Law Council of Australia Superannuation Conference, and has been a guest presenter in the University of Sydney Law School Taxation & Regulation of Superannuation course.

Public M&A. Iron Mountain's proposed acquisition of Recall by scheme (NYSE: IRM), New Zealand Oil & Gas' on-market bid for Cue Energy (ASX: NZO), Ochre Group Holdings' off-market bid for Gondwana Resources Limited (ASX: OGH) and Antofagasta's Australian reconstruction by scheme (LON: ANTO), as well as a number of applications before the Takeovers Panel.

Other work.  Serco's divestment of iconic Great Southern Rail, G.K. Goh's acquisition of 47% of AMP's Domain Group (SGX: G41) and bids for the NSW Government's staged divestment of electricity assets. WAGEC also provides basic necessities and a safe space to create community.

general.headline: General Counsel, Corporate Legal at National Australia Bank
general.description:
I am an experienced legal executive, with around 20 years in corporate & commercial legal practice.  I have been a trusted advisor to boards and senior executives on material transactions and corporate issues across private practice and in-house environments.  I have a track record of leading and motivating teams and producing outstanding results in difficult circumstances.

In my current role I lead a group of around 25 lawyers from the following teams: Corporate Advisory/M&A; Capital & Funding; Technology & IP; Commercial & Property; Employment; and Asset Management.  Over the years I have built a strong understanding of the evolving global regulatory environment, with experience working in financial services across multiple jurisdictions including Australia, NZ, Asia, the United Kingdom, North America and South America.  My primary areas of expertise include:
•	General Corporate Advice: Advising on corporate law and governance issues, including continuous disclosure, directors’ duties and financial reporting matters. 
•	M&A/Strategic Transactions: Advising on and negotiating acquisitions, disposals, joint ventures and strategic alliances. 
•	Capital Markets/Treasury: Advising on global equity and debt capital markets issuance.
•	Regulatory Investigations and Dispute Resolution: Advising on regulatory investigations and engagement with key regulators, including banking, securities and competition regulators. Advising on material disputes and insurance claims.  

I am a critical thinker with outstanding technical legal skills and exceptional academic results. I have broad commercial and management expertise, including as a director.  I am currently Chairman of NAB Ventures Pty Ltd, which operates NAB’s $50m venture capital fund for investments in fintech companies. I am also a director of National Australia Investment Capital Limited, which manages NAB’s investments in a range of industry joint ventures, such as Australia’s New Payments Platform.

general.headline: Partner - Major Projects and Construction at Clayton Utz
general.description:
Lina is a partner in Clayton Utz’s Major Projects & Construction Team. The national Major Projects & Construction team is consistently recognised as a Tier One Practice in Australia by both Chambers Asia Pacific and The Legal 500 Asia Pacific.  It is involved in some of the most significant infrastructure, construction and engineering projects  for public and private participants in the Asia-Pacific region.

Lina is an experienced construction and major projects lawyer, acting for owners (both government and private sector), financiers and contractors. She has advised on many of Australia’s biggest building and infrastructure projects, including WestConnex, the National Broadband Network, the delivery of a new $8bn metro line to Northwest Sydney and the iconic Barangaroo development. 

Lina has advised extensively on project structuring, contract drafting, tendering and advice during project implementation for major infrastructure matters. She has worked on projects in the rail, ports, roads, water and telecommunications sectors. Her experience spans the full range of delivery models including PPPs, D&C / construct only, alliancing, managing contractor and O&M / service outsourcing. 

In addition to her broad range of infrastructure experience, Lina has a deep understanding of the building sector, having acted for numerous property owners, developers and contractors across the commercial, residential and retail property sectors. 

Lina's approach been described by clients as commercial, pragmatic and proactive. She has a passion for working with clients to develop solutions that will deliver their commercial objectives.  Having had the opportunity to work in-house, she understands the pressures facing clients and how to best meet their needs. 

Lina has been recognised by Best Lawyers (2018) for Construction / Infrastructure Law.  She has also been consistently recommended by Doyles Guide as a Leading Front End Construction & Infrastructure Lawyer.

general.headline: Partner at MinterEllison
general.description:
Michael is the Practice Group Head of MinterEllison’s Projects, Infrastructure and Construction Group in Brisbane. He has over 28 years experience in the engineering and construction industry, including 8 years as a practicing civil engineer both in Australia and the UK.

He has an excellent reputation for innovative procurement and project delivery advice across a broad range of industry sectors.  Michael applies a common sense approach to identify project risks and providing guidance on the most appropriate delivery model for any given project.

Michael is also very experienced at providing contract administration advice and strategic advice concerning the prevention and management of disputes.  His civil engineering background means that Michael is able to understand the underlying technical issues – often critical to resolving claims quickly and favourably.

Michael has been independently recognised as one of Australia's top lawyers in Best Lawyers International (as published in The Australian Financial Review) for Construction / Infrastructure in 2012-2018, Transportation in 2015-2018, Alternative Dispute Resolution in 2016-2018 and Government Practice in 2016-2018.  He is also ranked on the Australian Doyle's Guide as 1 of 3 'Pre-eminent' Queensland front-end Construction Lawyers in 2017-2018. 

He has been an active member of the editorial board of the Australian Construction Law Bulletin (ACLB) since 2012 and is a sessional lecturer at the University of Queensland in Construction Law.

general.headline: Senior Associate at MinterEllison
general.description: I am an admitted attorney (solicitor) with a specialisation in banking and corporate finance law, comprising both debt and equity financing. I provide business legal services in most areas of corporate and commercial law, with an emphasis on finance. My areas of focus include secured and unsecured lending, leveraged and acquisition finance, project finance, property finance and preference share/private equity funding.

jobs.description:
I am a Senior Associate in the Corporate Finance team at MinterEllison, specializing in
      all aspects relating to transactional investment finance. My portfolio includes
      corporate, project, equity and property finance and I provide full business legal
      services to both lenders and borrowers in the Australasian market, including in respect
      of business funding requirements and security packages. My work includes
      transactions which are local, interstate and international and our team represents
      
      market-leading clients.

I was employed as the Legal Manager of a start-up banking services technology company trading under the name of "Celbux", which provides a mobile wallet technology which comprises innovative cashless banking functionalities. Celbux aims to establish a global presence and world-wide technology roll-out. During my time at Celbux, I was primarily involved in financing and corporate structuring in respect of the global roll-out of the Celbux business. This included creating and implementing debt and equity finance structures, corporate structures and completing commercial transactions within South Africa, the greater African continent and in Europe. I have been involved in capital raising, deal structuring and affiliated processes in this respect, which has also increased my exposure to South African exchange control processes, English law and cross-jurisdictional transactions. I provided specialist contract services to Celbux and l have been significantly involved in South African government tenders and tender processes, Public Finance Management Act related aspects, protection to personal information law and trademark registration throughout the African continent.

I was hired as an Associate and subsequently promoted to a Senior Associate in the Finance and Banking practice area of Bowman Gilfilan Inc. ("BG"), where I worked for the team of lawyers headed by Lionel Shawe, the practice head at the time, to whom I reported. 

At BG I provided business legal services in most areas of corporate and commercial law, with a specialisation in finance law, comprising both debt and equity financing. My areas of focus included secured and unsecured lending, leveraged and acquisition finance, project finance, property finance and preference share/private equity funding. I was also significantly involved in business rescue proceedings and emergency/DIP funding, with exposure to mining law and insolvency law issues. 

During my time at BG I was involved in a number of large-scale financing transactions, spanning across multiple jurisdictions including Europe, Australia, Africa and North America, primarily representing lenders. Most of the financing deals in which I have been involved constitute significant deals within South Africa’s economy. I am well versed in ALMA and LMA precedents and have had frequent exposure to English law transaction documents and security instruments. I have also gained experience in South African exchange control processes and procedures.

I completed my contract of articles (training contract) at DLA Cliffe Dekker Hofmeyer, which was an affiliate of DLA Piper Group during my employment ("DLA CDH"), whereafter I was retained as an Associate in the firm's Banking and Finance practice area. I was admitted as an attorney of the High Court of South Africa in accordance with the provisions of the Attorneys Act No. 53 of 1979 on 11 September 2012. 

Apart from practicing corporate financial law during my articles, I spent six months in DLA CDH's Employment Law practice, as well as another six months in DLA CDH's Competition and Consumer Law practice, serving my articles under some of South Africa's foremost attorneys in each of these fields. As such, I have a background in South African labour law, competition law and consumer protection law, in addition to my specialisation in finance law. 

During my employment in DLA CDH's Banking and Finance practice, I was exposed to a large number of high profile financing transactions spanning across multiple jurisdictions (including primarily Africa and Europe), in respect of both debt and equity financing. Our team represented both lenders and borrowers in various transactions and I drafted transaction documents based on both ALMA (African Loan Market Association) and LMA (Loan Market Association) precedents. In addition, I gained significant experience in closing transactions and issuing financial security, as well as in company secretarial matters and corporate law (including such aspects as incorporation of a company, creating the articles of association (MOI), resolutions and other corporate legislative requirements of a company, share issue and creation, company ring-fencing and related matters).

schools.degree: Legal Professional Administration Board Cross-qualification program

I completed a Master of Laws (LL.M) degree with a specialisation in Commercial Law from the University of Cape Town in 2009, with an overall aggregate of 74.6%. I ascribed to the coursework and dissertation LL.M curriculum and my coursework subjects included Competition Law (under Judge Dennis Davis), International Trade Law, International Economic Law and Biosafety Law. The dissertation component of the curriculum entails a 25 000 word thesis on a topic of the student’s choosing. My thesis, "Precaution or Paralysis: a review of the law regulating the trade in genetically modified organisms, from a South African perspective", was completed with distinction (75%).

I received the following awards: Phatsohane Henney Group Honour Medal 2008; Best Student in Tax Law 2008; Best Student in the Law of Negotiable Instruments 2008; Joubert Attorneys Floating Trophy for Best Student in Labour Law 2008; Danie and Chrissie Dorfling Floating Trophy 2008; All Africa Human Rights International Moot Court Competition Award for Best Speaker (English), held at the University of Pretoria, 2008; Best Resident in Final Year of Study at Skoonveld Ladies’ Residence, 2008; Phillip C. Jessup Moot Court Competition Representative, 2008; Brink Cohen Le Roux Incorporated Prize for Best Overall Pre-final Year LL.B Student, 2007; Judge Snyman Book Prize for Best Student in Law of Civil Procedure, 2007; S.W. Van Der Merwe Scholarship winner courtesy Hofmeyr Herbstein Ghiwala, 2007; Gildenhuys Lessing Malatji Incorporated Prize for Best Student in Law of Property, 2006; Jaques Tredoux Prize for Best Overall Second Year LL.B Student, 2006; Top Achiever's Dinner Invitee, 2005.

general.headline: Senior Associate
general.description:
I am a Senior Associate in the banking and finance team of Allens, a leading international law firm. 

I act for domestic and international financiers, borrowers, sponsors and government organizations in relation to all types of debt finance and specialize in project, energy and acquisition finance. 

My legal experience spans across a number of sectors including large-scale infrastructure (including PPPs), mining, oil & gas and renewables (solar, wind, battery, biofuel).

I have practiced for national and international law firms in London, São Paulo and Sydney and advised in jurisdictions including Australia, Asia, Latin America, Africa and Europe. 

I hold a LL.B (European) degree from both the University of East Anglia and the Universiteit Maastricht. I am a licensed Solicitor of the Senior Court of England & Wales, a Lawyer of the Supreme Court of New South Wales (Australia) and an Attorney of the State of New York. I am admitted to practice law in Brazil, as a Consultor em Direito Estrangeiro.

Specialties: Project Finance, Energy Finance, Acquisition Finance and Latin America Foreign Investment.

general.headline: Partner, Corporate and Structured Finance
general.description:
Tim is a corporate and a finance specialist and one of the launch partners for Hogan Lovells Australian practice, which commenced operations on 1 July 2015.  The Australian practice has offices in Perth and Sydney.

Tim leads the firm's corporate finance practice in Australia.  He has broad experience across the corporate transactional, corporate finance and structured finance fields, with a particular expertise on large project work in the energy and resources and infrastructure sectors.  He commonly advises major corporations and financial institutions on their investments in Australia, regionally and globally.   Tim also regularly works with or across from Governments and their agencies (including export credit agencies) on their participation in corporate and finance transactions generally.  Tim's expertise also extends to advice on corporate governance, trends and developments and foreign investment rules and compliance.

Immediately prior to joining Hogan Lovells in Australia, Tim was the head of the Japan Sector and a partner for more than seven years at Allens.  Prior to being at Allens, Tim was formerly at Hogan Lovells, where he was also a partner.  He worked for 13 years across London, Hong Kong and Tokyo and was Managing Partner of the firm's Tokyo office prior to relocating to Australia in 2008.

Tim is fluent in Japanese.

In addition to his work as a lawyer, Tim is a Governor of the WA Museum Foundation. Tim is also currently a member of the Executive Committee of the Australia Japan Business Cooperation Committee, formerly a member of the Board of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade’s Australia Japan Foundation, Chair of The University of Western Australia Business School’s Ambassadorial Council, and was a member of the Attorney General’s International Legal Services Advisory Council.

I bring to the table a broad experience of commercial transactions and project finance structuring principles.

In a similar vein, a deep interest in social justice and policy, led to my involvement in MinterEllison's community investment and pro bono programs (CI&PB) and my recent appointment as the Sydney Office CI&PB partner. 

This has also shaped my involvement with Enablr Fundraising an innovative e-solution to the fundraising challenge faced by the Not For Profit community, which establishes a low cost platform for donor matching and other media and financial services to the NFP sector.

After starting out with Merrill Lynch in the US junk bond market in the late 1980s, he has worked on a string of landmark deals including the massive leveraged buy out of RJR Nabisco in the US and the hostile takeover of Burns Philp by Goodman Fielder. Over more recent years, Michael has led the Asian financing teams at Credit Suisse in significant financings across the Asia Pacific and US leveraged finance markets including the Rank/Carter Holt Harvey/Reynolds Group (US$10b+) and Fortescue (US$5b).

Michael is recognised by the Leverage Finance industry as one of the leading practitioners in Asia Pacific.  He has been awarded Euroweek’s Champion of Leveraged Finance for Asia Pacific and has won numerous Deal Of The Year awards.  He is a respected industry commentator who is a regular presenter at international industry conferences including the BRW, Credit Suisse Investor Days, AVCAL and IFR Leverage Finance conferences

jobs.description:
Michael joined CSFB in February 1993, was appointed head of Leveraged & Acquisition Finance for Australia in 1997 and was promoted to Director in 1999. Since joining Credit Suisse Michael has built a successful and expanding business specialising in the origination, execution and syndication of leveraged and acquisition financings for corporate and financial sponsor clients.

Credit Suisse is the clear leader in leveraged and acquisition finance in Australasia, as evidenced by rankings for syndicated financing and Michael and his team’s leadership position has enhanced the broader franchise of the firm. 

Michael is a team player who has built a strong team culture within his business unit over a long period.  This has resulted in a stable and effective team that has delivered a consistently high standard of client service and is a major reason for his success.
SBC Dominguez Barry

As Australia's population ages, investment appetite for income-based investment options and capital preservation is increasing. Investor Sales match this demand for cash-flow security with market leading access to specialist investment solutions to middle market institutions, high net worth individuals, financial advisers, brokers and other intermediaries who manage client portfolios. Investor Sales has offices in Australia, New Zealand, New York, London, Hong Kong, Japan and Singapore.

Applying customer focused approach to broaden accessibility to quality investment opportunities for non-institutional investors (via transaction selection, platform/infrastructure, education & ease).

Investment opportunities are spread across both ASX listed and unlisted formats and include Simple Corporate Bonds, Social Impact Bonds, Subordinated Notes, High Yield Bonds, Hybrids, A-REITs, Managed Funds/Investment Schemes (Property, Agriculture, Listed Investment Companies, Listed Investment Trusts), and Equity. 

Some recent transactions include high yield bond transactions for Afterpay Touch Group, NEXTDC Limited, QMS Media, and Centuria; LIC for Antipodes Partners, VGI Partners, L1 Capital and Wilson Asset Management; LIT for Magellan Financial Group, Gryphon Capital Investments, and Neuberger Berman; IPOs for Charter Hall Long WALE REIT, Convenience Retail REIT, Viva Energy (& REIT); unlisted equity capital raising for Australian Unity Healthcare Property Fund and Southern Cross Poultry Fund.

general.headline: ▪️Institutional Banking & Private Wealth Specialist ▪️Engenders Trust & Followership▪️High Performance Leader▪️Inclusive
general.description:
I am a highly experienced financial services executive with a strong track record of delivering financial results and strong customer NPS across institutional banking, private wealth management and debt capital markets. Visionary, pragmatic, focused, commercial, respected, courageous and performance driven are words that describe my leadership style, my capability and my attitude. 

My true strength is in how I knit strategy and the team’s belief together to bring people on the execution journey. This is where the real work starts. Activities are wasteful without the right focus and culture to deliver daily in pursuit of customer service. I am a very passionate people leader and believe that business is a team sport. This is why I am complimenting my extensive business and financial markets formal education with my Masters in HR Management. Mobilising large teams of people to execute strategy, while undergoing significant organisational change, is enormously challenging and my studies help me determine how to scale, what I do intuitively, around people leadership and management. 

I have an enormous curiosity about learning while doing that is evidenced by my re-designing businesses and shaping cultures to meet the rapidly changing customer value propositions that simply challenge the way things have been done for decades. Risk is central to my thinking and I balance business growth with de-risking when the right capabilities are not in place. I am very comfortable with ambiguity and I manage ambiguity for teams, consistently demonstrating a strong vision for the business I lead, letting teams know where we are going and how we are going to get there.  

My aspiration is to keep growing as a leader so I can bring out the best in people and in teams; all in pursuit of excellence in customer experience.

I have worked in banking for over a decade; in Relationship Management and Research and Analysis for commercial and corporate property clients, and in sustainable finance: including social and environmental risk, building staff awareness and capacity of sustainable finance, sustainable finance strategy and client advisory.

I managed ANZ Institutional's partnership with the conservation organisation WWF-Australia; including developing staff expertise for opportunity generation and risk management. Developed, enabled and assisted facilitation of half-day training workshops delivered to over 750 ANZ Institutional relationship, product and risk staff throughout Australia, Hong Kong, Indonesia, New Zealand and Singapore. 

Developed and led the implementation of ANZ's publicly disclosed, audited,  bank-wide $10 billion Sustainable Solutions low-carbon target, which relates to capturing finance opportunities in the sustainability sector. 

Was on the Banks's working group developing strategy and methodology for financed emissions.

Currently focused on client advisory for raising funds in the capital markets, through green, social and sustainability bonds. 

Outside of work Alex is a (retired) qualified ski instructor, volunteer surf lifesaver, yogi, and family person.

jobs.description:
 Delivery and implementation of product based strategies that enable each business segment and brand to achieve their respective strategies, customer value propositions, market position and financial targets. 
 Delivery and implementation of product portfolio strategies against plan and optimises portfolio profitability, diversification, mix and growth, cost, arrears, capital and risk management, and process effectiveness.

Role
 Responsible for the origination of new clients and portfolio management and cross sell targets for existing clients. 
 Responsibilities also include defining and driving strategy, achieving P&L and asset targets and performance management of the team.
 Existing portfolio of clients includes 12 relationships with total lending commitments and internal product limits in excess of A$2.5bn. 
 MC at Town Halls for business updates and general comms, Chair of the Colleague Engagement Committee and Member of the Leadership Group.
 Prepared analysis and information for the IM and management presentations in relation to the sale of the Australian business to Westpac. Currently project lead on repatriating a select group of ten clients back to the UK balance sheet. Involves project management and troubleshooting across functional areas and geographies.

Achievements
 Proven origination and acquisition of new clients against a backdrop of shifting strategies with 8 new clients acquired in the past 2 years against initial commitments of A$1bn.
 Proven relationship management skills as demonstrated by an independent survey of clients. The Peter Lee Corporate Relationship Banking Survey ranked the business in 2012 and 2013 as having the strongest Relationship Strength for any international bank with its client base.
   87% of clients rate their level of satisfaction as "Above Average" or "Excellent".
   73% of clients rate their Relationship Manager as "Above Average" or "Excellent".
   45% of clients recognize the bank as providing the most creative ideas and solutions.
 Demonstrated cross sell capabilities with more than 50% of available products to the bank provided across core clients, achieving above internal hurdle returns on RWAs.
 Industry experience includes: Transport, Infrastructure, Telcos, Media, Utilities, Healthcare, Packaging, Manufacturing, Construction and Business Services.

Role
 Responsible for the origination and execution of private equity / financial sponsored deals through to credit approval, documentation and drawdown.

Achievements
 Developed deep debt structuring, documentation and deal management skills across 20+ transactions including corporate acquisition financing, leveraged and management buyouts.
 Completed lead arranger / bookrunner / underwriter roles, operating through the capital structure from bridge loans and senior syndicated facilities to subordinated funding.
 Developed broad sector experience.

Role
 Supported the Head of in origination and business development activities.
 Responsible for structuring and executing funding needs across clients’ debt capital structure.

Achievements
 Transactions included sub and mezzanine debt for private equity led deals to bridge funding for equity contributions, right through to margin loans for a high net worth family.

 Provided insolvency expertise to companies in administration and operating as a going concern. 
 Provided financial advice and services to companies in distress, including formulation of turnaround and sales strategies.
 Developed commercial, operational, financial and risk skills and experienced behaviors of shareholders, directors, customers and banks as they are wound up.

 Provided internal and external audit services across multiple sectors.
      

     Developed strong technical skills by completing Chartered Accounting qualification.
      

     Developed solid project management skills and directly responsible for two large and
      
      complex projects with multiple stakeholders, including State Government departments.

jobs.description:
The Manly ferry Baragoola was launched in 1922, the last of six similar sister ships that came to typify the classic Manly ferry for eighty years and the oldest surviving Australian-built Manly Ferry. Weighing in at 498 tonnes she had a passenger capacity of 1,523 people and served from 1922 up until the launch of Freshwater in 1983.

The aim of the Baragoola Preservation Association Incorporated is to restore the ship (which is currently moored at the foot of the Old Coal Loader at Balls Head) to as near as possible to her operational condition.

general.headline: Manager - Sydney at Burgess Paluch Legal Recruitment
general.description:
I am a specialist legal recruiter with more than 10 years' experience in the legal market both in my home country of New Zealand and in Australia.

In NZ I set up the legal division of a global recruitment agency. I was highly successful in placing lawyers within New Zealand’s top-tier firms and was the first NZ recruiter to place NZ lawyers directly into Sydney’s top-tier firms. I undertook numerous campaigns in NZ for one of Australia's pre-eminent law firms. When that agency was purchased by a London based, global specialised legal recruiter I was asked to relocate to Sydney where I was instrumental in setting up the Sydney arm of the business. I led a team and successfully recruited lawyers into Sydney’s top, mid-tier and boutique firms.

I then spent time away from recruitment to focus on the new addition to my family (twin boys!) and joined Burgess Paluch to set up their Sydney based business in 2014.

Having previously worked with both directors, I am excited to work in an agency that mirrors my ethical, solutions focused and professional style. I believe that being a successful recruiter is first and foremost about building and sustaining long term relationships with both my clients and candidates. 

I have significant experience placing lawyers at all levels within the Sydney market and have developed strong contacts from junior lawyers to partner level.

general.headline: Manager at Hays Legal | Recruiting Experts in Legal and Company Secretarial
general.school: Legal Practice Unit, University of Wollongong
general.description:
We are the experts in recruiting qualified, professional and skilled people across a wide range of specialised industries and professions. We operate across the private and public sectors, dealing in permanent positions, contract roles and temporary assignments.

At Hays, we believe the right job can transform a person's life and the right person can transform a business. We're passionate about connecting our candidates with the right job for them.

As at 30 June 2016 the Group employed 9,214 staff operating from 252 offices in 33 countries across 20 specialisms. For the year ended 30 June 2016 Hays reported net fees of £810.3 million and operating profit (pre-exceptional items) of £181 million. Hays placed around 67,000 candidates into permanent jobs and around 220,000 people into temporary assignments. 22% of Group net fees were generated in Asia Pacific.

For the 2015-16 financial year Hays in Australia & New Zealand placed 12,200 people into permanent jobs, or 47 per day. We also filled nearly 62,000 temporary jobs, or 240 per day.

We are members of the Recruitment & Consulting Services Association, and have been accredited with the International Quality Standard ISO 9001:2008 since 1993.

Devoted to both clients and candidates, we power the world of work.

general.description:
Phillip Hunter is recognised as the leading in-house legal recruitment/search professional in the APAC region. For over a decade Phillip has fervently developed and nurtured an unparalleled network of clients, candidates and contributors (CCC). These relationships enable Phillip to deliver bespoke talent solutions, in-depth market advice and intel which help CCC stay ahead of the market. Combined, Phillip provides quality results quickly.

Phillip has successfully developed and lead teams of highly specialised technical senior experts covering private practice, in-house banking & finance legal, in-house commerce & industry legal, speciality legal (eg. company secretariat and compliance/risk) recruitment specialisations.

Based in Sydney Phillip has worked on a number of cross border assignments capitalising on his expansive network, strong legal knowledge and sector relationships across the globe. Phillip’s market knowledge is further strengthened through talent/market mapping, career counselling and industry association involvement. 

Phillip believes all recruitment/search professionals should strive to be a Maven… A maven (also mavin) is a trusted expert in a particular field, who seeks to pass knowledge on to others. The word comes from Hebrew, meaning "one who understands", based on an accumulation of knowledge. Phillip prides himself on being a MAVEN above all else.

Phillip's experience is across the FMCG, media & entertainment, marketing & communications, manufacturing, accounting, consulting & professional services, energy & resources, retail & franchise, travel, trade & transport, information technology and telecommunications, property, infrastructure & construction, health & pharmaceuticals & government & education sectors.

general.headline: Partner at Sparke Helmore Lawyers
general.description: I am an experienced solicitor practising in the defence of personal injury and professional negligence claims commenced in Queensland. During my career, I have defended claims at the instruction of large local insurers, international insurers including numerous Lloyds syndicates, coverholders, third party claims administrators, insureds, companies under-excess, uninsured entities and individuals, and the Queensland Government. I have defended claims emerging from a wide variety of industries, including numerous claims relating to health care, legal, financial, building and construction, and aviation.  By working closely with insurers and other interested parties, I have developed a commercially focused claims management style to minimise risks and costs associated with claims of this nature.

jobs.description:
I am a Partner in the Commercial Insurance team in the Brisbane office of Sparke
      Helmore Lawyers, working in a team focused on defending liability and professional
      negligence claims for our local and international insurer clients. We provide coverage
      advice on first and third party claims, defend PIPA claims, litigated liability and PI
      
      claims, undertake recovery proceedings both large and small.

Senior Associate in the Commercial Insurance team at Sparke Helmore in Brisbane
      defending liability and professional negligence claims for local and international insurer
      
      clients.

I held the role of Claims Counsel and team leader of Caveo, the in-house legal division of Triton Global (Australia). Caveo was created within Triton to primarily manage and defend public liability claims (under the PIPA pre-court protocol) for insurer clients and large insureds. Caveo developed into a very client-focused, cost-efficient alternative for clients who are exposed to personal injury claims in Queensland.
I provided in-house legal services to the Triton team where possible, including adding a legal perspective to the Triton Adjusting services now offered in Australia. 
In addition to in-house legal services, I undertook specialised audit work for large insurer/re-insurer clients and provided detailed reports on public liability claim portfolios across multiple Australian jurisdictions.

Performed litigation and defendant insurance work at one of Queensland leading independent law firms. Areas of specialty included aviation claims, professional indemnity (including representing solicitors in defence of PI claims), medical malpractice (including being an approved Queensland Health lawyer), in addition to general litigation and public liability claims (both litigated and under PIPA).
During my time at CGW, I was also involved with the following organisations:
- Australasian College of Health Service Managers (ACHSM) - CPD committee member for two years
- Human Research Ethics Committee (HREC) for the Central Districts Health Service District - legal committee member for two years
- Aviation Law Association of Australia and New Zealand (ALAANZ) - Queensland branch committee member for two years and member of National Conference Organising Committee (2012)

I continued my work in aquaculture by taking a role as a hatchery technician at MBPF. In the hatchery we harvested eggs from adult prawns and labouriously tended to all stages of the development in shifts over 24 hours per day, including growing algal food for the juvenile hatchlings. 
During a second season at MBPF, I undertook work at the grow-out ponds and was involved in all aspects of monitoring and managing the growth of prawns and harvesting at the end of season.

The ERCF is a remote crocodile farm located on Cape York and owned by the local Aboriginal community. I took up a field role at ERCF after completing my science degree and was initially taking samples from new crocodile hatchlings and adult males to send back to UQ for use in a genetic study. That role developed into an active working role within the farm and eventually a stint as hatchery manager, where around 5000 hatchlings were produced and grown out per season.
The role was very challenging due to the isolated location and working at close proximity with an apex predator. It was also very rewarding to work with the indigenous owners of the farm and contribute meaningfully to the community.

schools.description: My study time included an exchange to Glasgow University in Scotland, where I studied EU law and other electives not ordinarily studied in Queensland. From 2004, I studied on a part time basis whilst working full time at Hunt & Hunt Lawyers (now Cooper Grace Ward Lawyers).
I tailored the science degree to ensure I was exposed to a broad range of specialty areas including, ecology, biology, zoology, marine and aquaculture, environment and conservation, and geosciences.

general.headline: Manager Casework at Family and Community Services Murrumbidgee/Far West/Western District Services Team

jobs.description:
I am a manager casework and have been working with FACS - Child Protection for 17 years.  During this time I have undertaken a number of roles in a variety of locations and differing demographics.I have worked in and managed child protection-assessing risk of harm to children, Out of Home Care when children have entered the statutory care system, Triage & Assessment,Joint assessments with the NSW Police re reports of sexual assault, severe physical abuse and or neglect.
Management roles:Manager Casework-managing casework teams, the A/Manager Client Services-managing a FACS community services centre and the teams therein as noted above,A/Manager Housing Services-managing all housing responsibilities/teams in FACS for the Murrumbidgee District.More contemporaneously I have been managing the Interstate Transfer/Carer Support Team. This role has enhanced my casework skills and management thereof from both within the NSW care system and also including the formal transfer of children in out of care, to the care responsibility of other states by facilitating the formal transfer of these matters via our interstate peer court jurisdictions. As well as enhanced my knowledge of key carer functions, such as but not limited to; WWCC’s, carer training and development as well as carer authorisation processes and carer review functions and requirements.
I am passionate about the children, young people and families FACS works with,with a keen interest in maintaining the family unit, family finding and the reunification of children to their families of origin. Additionally, I am extremely committed to the well being of those who work in this challenging and demanding sector with a view that practitioners require continued development/support and supervision  structures to ensure their welling and in turn implement robust, holistic and engaging casework to the vulnerable families we serve.  
My participation on this forum is not that as a FACS representative but as an individual.
